PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Mrs. Lenora Jones, 119 Jane Street, Carnegie, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 8, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Should jitney drivers be licensed and permitted to operate, or should they be jailed?" answer reads: "I don't think that they should be permitted to operate. It just does not seem right to me.  However, I do not think that they should be placed in jail.  They only should be jailed if they keep operating after being stopped and warned."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Lenora Jones wearing heathered coat, standing in front of marble wall between store windows, one on right with mens necktie display
